author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: سُبْحانَكَ اللَّهُمَّ يا إِلهِي أَسْئَلُكَ بِهُبُوبِ أَرْياحِ فَضْلِكَ وَبِمَشارِقِ وَحْيِكَ وَمَطالِعِ إِلْهامِكَ بِأَنْ تُنَزِّلَ عَلَيَّ وَعَلَى مَنْ أَرادَ وَجْهَكَ ما يَنْبَغِي لِكَرَمِكَ وَإِحْسانِكَ وَما يَلِيقُ لِمَواهِبِكَ وَأَلْطافِكَ، أَيْ رَبِّ أَنَا الفَقِيرُ فَأَدْخِلْنِي فِيْ لُجَّةِ غَنائِكَ وَأَنَا الظَّمْآنُ فَأَشْرِبْنِي كَوْثَرَ
translation: Glorified art Thou, O Lord my God! I implore Thee by the onrushing winds of Thy grace, and by them Who are the Daysprings of Thy purpose and the Dawning-Places of Thine inspiration, to send down upon me and upon all that have sought Thy face that which beseemeth Thy generosity and bountiful grace, and is worthy of Thy bestowals and favors. Poor and desolate I am, O my Lord! Immerse me in the ocean of Thy wealth; athirst, suffer me to drink from the living waters of Thy loving-kindness.
